Newton II merci Monsieur
a votre santé miss you Dan
heroin toys are aboot say trivia Maurice
poopoo vivo tiramisu bonsoir monsieur de
vivir sin example men the search in the
footpath elevator machina die in these
difficult times who tend to dwell on our
own problems but it's important to take
a moment now and then to reflect on
those better off than we are to think
about the plight of the more fortunate
and how better to immerse ourselves in
the concerns of the rich and frivolous
than with luis buñuel great the discreet
charm of the bourgeoisie which won the
Oscar for Best Foreign Film in 1972 this
film is a comedy of manners it's a
bedroom farce it's a political satire
it's a gothic melodrama it's a religious
allegory it's all of these things but
it's not any one of them Luis buñuel was
one of the great artists of the 20th
century he started out in the 1930s
making provocative blasphemous films
with Salvador Dali he fled Franco and
ended up in Mexico where his work took
on a much more politically and socially
conscious tinge in the 1960s and 70s he
wound up in France he began shooting in
color he cast his films with well-known
French movie stars and his work took on
a veneer of sophisticated absurdity a
kind of worldly mischief
imitating Arabic food respect Raja
commader
llamo fellow traveler who's a reason
Vita Enid her big fool now by Bourjois Z
Boone well meant the ruling class and by
discrete charm he meant utter
indifference complete complacency
detachment from reality
this is conveyed not just in the blase
manners of all of the characters in this
movie but in the very structure of the
film itself it moves from dream to
reality without quite telling you which
is which nor does it indicate whether
what's happening on-screen is meant to
look like comedy or tragedy now Boone
well has a great time lampooning the
selfishness and complacency of the very
rich but these attitudes have
consequences in the real world and all
evidence to the contrary the discreet
charm of the bourgeoisie is anything but
a joke
